description: Returns information about the working storage of a gateway. This operation is only supported in the stored volumes gateway type. This operation is deprecated in cached volumes API version (20120630). Use DescribeUploadBuffer instead. The response includes disk IDs that are configured as working storage, and it includes the amount of working storage allocated and used.

parameters.name: GatewayARN
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway. Use the  ListGateways operation to return a list of gateways for your account and Amazon Web Services Region.

nested_items.name: GatewayARN
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway. Use the  ListGateways operation to return a list of gateways for your account and Amazon Web Services Region.

nested_items.name: DiskIds
nested_items.description: An array of the gateway's local disk IDs that are configured as working storage. Each local disk ID is specified as a string (minimum length of 1 and maximum length of 300). If no local disks are configured as working storage, then the DiskIds array is empty.

nested_items.name: WorkingStorageUsedInBytes
nested_items.description: The total working storage in bytes in use by the gateway. If no working storage is configured for the gateway, this field returns 0.

nested_items.name: WorkingStorageAllocatedInBytes
nested_items.description: The total working storage in bytes allocated for the gateway. If no working storage is configured for the gateway, this field returns 0.
